suppress.notes:
file name: commons-compress-1.18.jar he file name encoding algorithm used internally in Apache Commons Compress 1.15 to 1.18 can get into an infinite loop when faced with specially crafted inputs. This can lead to a denial of service attack if an attacker can choose the file names inside of an archive created by Compress. CVSSv2: Base Score: MEDIUM (5.0) Vector: /AV:N/AC:L/Au:N/C:N/I:N/A:P CVSSv3: Base Score: HIGH (7.5) Vector: /AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:N/A:H
References: MISC - https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/308cc15f1f1dc53e97046fddbac240e6cd16de89a2746cf257be7f5b@%3Cdev.commons.apache.org%3E

file name: okhttp-3.11.0.jar ** DISPUTED ** CertificatePinner.java in OkHttp 3.x through 3.12.0 allows man-in-the-middle attackers to bypass certificate pinning by changing SSLContext and the boolean values while hooking the application. NOTE: This id is disputed because some parties don't consider this is a vulnerability. Their rationale can be found in https://github.com/square/okhttp/issues/4967.
This is latest version for now, ignoreing until they releas a new version of html unit driver file name: htmlunit-core-js-2.36.0.jar file name: neko-htmlunit-2.36.0.jar
file name: htmlunit-cssparser-1.5.0.jar, regex for cve CVE-2020-5529 is htmlunit* which hits cssparser
